private_information: I model actions, their required facts, and their immediate effects.
I will produce a structured analysis of preconditions and effects for each available action rather than a planner output.
manipulator.goal: Analyze each action (paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted) and produce a clear, structured mapping of preconditions, add effects, and delete effects referencing the objects in the environment.

private_information: I synthesize candidate action sequences from structured action descriptions.
I avoid emitting domain/problem PDDL; I produce stepwise candidate plans, causal links, and identified ambiguities or missing information.
planner.goal: Using action analyses and the initial state, propose candidate plans to reach the stated goal, annotate causal links and unresolved references.

private_information: I audit temporal and causal consistency and remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, or ad-hoc state hacks.
I will flag steps that rely on ephemeral bookkeeping and provide corrected, conservative transformations to ensure soundness.
auditor.goal: Review candidate plans and action models for temporal/causal consistency and produce an audit report describing corrections and safe-to-assume transformations.

private_information: I integrate the structured analysis, planner candidates, and auditor corrections into a final PDDL domain and problem targeted to the FastDownward solver.
I must keep agent actions distinct and annotate agent-specific actions when producing the multi-agent PDDL domain.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a FastDownward-compatible PDDL domain and problem that encodes the actions, initial facts, and the goal: next object_12 object_10, next object_13 object_10, next object_14 object_9.

public_information: Available actions: paltry(object_0,object_1,object_2), sip(object_0,object_1,object_2), clip(object_0,object_1,object_2), wretched(object_0,object_1,object_2,object_3), memory(object_0,object_1,object_2), tightfisted(object_0,object_1,object_2).
Action preconditions and effects follow a domain-specific relational vocabulary: hand(X), cats(X), texture(X), vase(X,Y), next(X,Y), sneeze(X), stupendous(X), collect(X,Y), spring(X).
Summarized action constraints provided by the human: paltry requires hand A, cats B, texture C, vase A B, next B C; paltry adds next A C and deletes vase A B.
sip requires hand A, cats B, texture C, next A C, next B C; sip adds vase A B and deletes next A C.
clip requires hand A, sneeze B, texture C, next B C, next A C; clip adds vase A B and deletes next A C.
wretched requires sneeze A, texture B, texture C, stupendous D, next A B, collect B D, collect C D; wretched adds next A C and deletes next A B.
memory requires cats A, spring B, spring C, next A B; memory adds next A C and deletes next A B.
tightfisted requires hand A, sneeze B, texture C, next B C, vase A B; tightfisted adds next A C and deletes vase A B.

Initial facts (human statement): cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_10 object_3, collect object_11 object_3, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_12, hand object_13, hand object_14, next object_0 object_6, next object_1 object_9, next object_12 object_11, next object_13 object_6, next object_14 object_8, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_10, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_9, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_10, texture object_11, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9.
Goal (human): achieve next object_12 object_10, next object_13 object_10, next object_14 object_9.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an expert in formalizing action descriptions and their direct preconditions and effects. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a structured, unambiguous mapping for each of the following actions: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted. For each action instance template, list parameters, preconditions as a set of groundable predicates, add-effects, and delete-effects. Identify any implicit assumptions or ambiguous object name usages in the provided action descriptions.
analyze.prompt: Your name is manipulator. Use the public information: {environment->public_information} and your private information: {agents->manipulator->private_information}. Provide the requested structured analysis as a concise JSON-like list of action models, with parameter names aligned to the action descriptions. Do not produce domain/problem PDDL or planning sequences.

synthesize_plan.system_prompt: You are an experienced planner that works from structured action models and a concrete initial state. Do not produce final PDDL; instead, generate candidate step sequences, annotate causal links, precondition achievers, and any unresolved open preconditions. Point out where multiple alternative achievers exist and trade-offs between plans.
synthesize_plan.prompt: Your name is planner. Using the analysis in {analysis_manipulator} together with the environment public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->planner->private_information}, propose one or more candidate plans (ordered lists of action instances) that could achieve the goal: next object_12 object_10, next object_13 object_10, next object_14 object_9. For each plan, list required preconditions at each step, which initial facts satisfy them or which prior actions achieve them, and any assumptions you make. Do not emit PDDL; keep the output as structured plan candidates and commentary.

audit.system_prompt: You are a domain auditor specialized in temporal and causal consistency. Your job is to remove bookkeeping shortcuts, flag post-hoc corrections, and provide conservative transformations so the plan remains implementable without relying on ad-hoc tokens or ephemeral state hacks.
audit.prompt: Your name is auditor. Receive the action analysis {analysis_manipulator} and plan candidates {plan_candidates}. Produce an audit report that (1) identifies temporal or causal inconsistencies, (2) removes or replaces bookkeeping shortcuts, (3) suggests corrected plan steps or action-model refinements to ensure soundness. Produce a short prioritized list of required changes and a reconciled, safe plan outline.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in producing PDDL domains and problems for the FastDownward planner. Integrate the structured action models, planner candidates, and auditor corrections. Keep agent actions distinct by prefixing action names with the originating agent name when appropriate. Produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that are FastDownward-compatible and sufficient to achieve the goal. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the domain includes clear typing or STRIPS-compatible predicates and that the problem encodes the initial facts and the specified goal.
pddl.prompt: Your name is orchestrator. Integrate {analysis_manipulator}, {plan_candidates}, and {audit_report} with the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->orchestrator->private_information}. Think step by step, resolve naming ambiguities, keep agent actions distinct, and emit the final PDDL domain and problem targeting FastDownward. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
